title: SABIC reaffirms commitment to processing 1M tons of circular materials annually by 2030 - BIC Magazine
summary: SABIC, a global leader in the chemicals industry, has reaffirmed its commitment to accelerating the circular carbon economy by unveiling its ambition to process one million metric tons (1000kt) of TRUCIRCLE™ solutions annually by 2030. SABIC's certified circular polymers and technologies are offered through TRUCIRCLE™, a set of solutions launched to help give value chain partners access to more sustainable materials. Construction of the company's first commercial unit in Geleen, the Netherlands is now entering the final stages and deliveries of first circular polymers are expected in 2023.
green_innovation: TRUE, as the innovation contributes to environmental sustainability goals, such as reducing or replacing harmful substances, reducing resource consumption by developing a circular economy, and the protection of biological systems.
business_innovation: TRUE, as the innovation is a new or improved product (TRUCIRCLE™ solutions) that differs significantly from the firm's previous products and has been introduced on the market.
green_product: TRUE, as the product (TRUCIRCLE™ solutions) is designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces its environmental impact throughout its life cycle.
green_process: TRUE, as the process (advanced recycling) is a method or technique in manufacturing that minimizes environmental impacts and promotes sustainability.
